intro: Lantana dinteri var. punctata, commonly known as the Dinter's lantana, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, and features narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
